definition: to break (e.g. stick or bone)/a loss
to turn sth over/to turn upside down/to tip sth out (of a container)

to break/to fracture/to snap/to suffer loss/to bend/to twist/to turn/to change direction/convinced/to convert into (currency)/discount/rebate/tenth (in price)/classifier for theatrical scenes/to fold/accounts book

to fasten/to button/button/buckle/knot/to arrest/to confiscate/to deduct (money)/discount/to knock/to smash, spike or dunk (a ball)/to cover (with a bowl etc)/(fig.) to tag a label on sb/(Tw) (loanword) code
to give a discount/to be of less value than anticipated

sentences.english: The Card doesn't actually give you discounts on beer.
sentences.chinese: 这张卡并没有给你啤酒的折扣。

sentences.english: There's a discount for these sample copies.
We can allow you a discount.
sentences.chinese: 我们可以给你方打个折扣。

sentences.english: We just go to the one with the best bargains.
sentences.chinese: 我们只是去可以打最大折扣的商店。

sentences.english: Normally we do not give any discounts, because the prices have already been greatly reduced.
sentences.chinese: 通常我们是不打折扣的，因为价钱已经减得很低。

sentences.english: The sample application is an online discount shop for members only.
sentences.chinese: 示例应用程序是一个只允许会员访问的在线折扣店。

sentences.english: Your unit price seems fair enough, but we're hoping for a higher discount rate.
sentences.chinese: 单价仿佛公道，但我们希看赐与更高的折扣率。

sentences.english: It only takes a minute to submit a request for a rebate.
sentences.chinese: 申请这个折扣只需要花一分钟时间。

sentences.english: I'm sorry. Discount cards and vouchers are not to be used together.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，折扣卡和赠券不能同时使用。

sentences.english: Market is inundating with lenders , who are willing to give discounts .
sentences.chinese: 市场是迷倒与放款人，谁愿意给予折扣。

sentences.english: You may qualify for rent discount by doing part-time groundskeeping.
sentences.chinese: 做草地维护的兼职或者可以让你享受租金折扣价哦。

sentences.english: The standard multi-year discount will cease to apply on 3 year orders only.
sentences.chinese: 标准多年折扣仅不适用于3年期订单。

sentences.english: He sings well, and KTV places have discount rates during daytimes. Or we can go traveling, or take day trips…
sentences.chinese: 他唱得很好，KTV的地方在白天可以享受折扣优惠。

sentences.english: Distributors are encouraged to refer to the ordering tools, which have been updated to account for the new discount.
sentences.chinese: 建议总经销商通过订购工具查看最新的折扣。

sentences.english: The discount given by the syndicate to members of the selling group.
sentences.chinese: 辛迪加向出售团成员提供的折扣。

sentences.english: If you're only going to order fifty, it will have to be without a discount.
sentences.chinese: 如果您只订五十台，就没办法打折扣。

definition: buy one, get one free/two for the price of one
to give a discount/to be of less value than anticipated
cheap/inexpensive/small advantages/to let sb off lightly
abbr. for 特別優惠|特别优惠[te4 bie2 you1 hui4]/ex gratia
bond (esp. document split in two, with each party holding one half)/contract/deed (i.e. title deeds)/ticket/voucher/certificate
to cut the price/to drive down the price/to get cheaper
